metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5806 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
An error within the "leaf_hdr_load_raw()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.8 can be exploited to trigger a NULL pointer dereference.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.11-1
libraw20 - 0.18.11-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> Fixed in trusty / xenial via debian/patches/security_0.18.8_2.patch

criterions.comment: darktable package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.11-1').
rawtherapee package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
